info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued March 13 at 6:31AM MDT by NWS GreatFalls
info.description: ...Reduced Visibility and Slippery Surfaces this Morning... Areas of fog have developed this morning along the Rocky Mountain Front and over portions of the plains of North Central Montana. This fog was especially prevalent in low-lying areas, with visibilities as low as one quarter of a mile. Travelers should be prepared for rapidly changing conditions over short distances. In addition to reduced visibilities, travelers should be prepared for slippery road surfaces given temperatures are below freezing, especially on elevated surfaces like bridges and overpasses. The fog is expected to dissipate through 11 AM MDT. Slow down, allow extra following distances between vehicles, and use low beam headlights when driving through fog.
